Package system

Class TwoDimArrayUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • system.TwoDimArrayUtil
  • public class TwoDimArrayUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a set of utility methods that process two-dimensional arrays.
    Author:
    cmsc132, UMCP

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TwoDimArrayUtil()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static char[][] appendLeftRight​(char[][] left, char[][] right)
      Returns a new two-dimensional array of characters where rows with the same index in the left and right arrays have been combined (row from right array appended to corresponding row from left array).
      static char[][] appendTopBottom​(char[][] top, char[][] bottom)
      Returns a new two-dimensional array of characters where elements from the top array appear first, follow by elements from the bottom array.
      static boolean isRagged​(char[][] array)
      Returns true if the array is a ragged array and false otherwise.
      static void rotateLeftOneColumn​(char[][] array)
      Rotates the array by shifting columns one position to the left (second column will become the first column, third column will become the second column, etc.).
      static void rotateTopOneRow​(char[][] array)
      Rotates the array by shifting rows one position up (second row will become the first row, third row will become the second row, etc.).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TwoDimArrayUtil

        public TwoDimArrayUtil()

    • Method Detail

      • isRagged

        public static boolean isRagged​(char[][] array)
        Returns true if the array is a ragged array and false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        array - two-dimensional array of characters
        Returns:
        true if ragged; false otherwise

      • rotateTopOneRow

        public static void rotateTopOneRow​(char[][] array)
        Rotates the array by shifting rows one position up (second row will become the first row, third row will become the second row, etc.). The first row will become the last row. To get the most practice you should not create a new array in order to perform the rotation. No processing takes place if the array only has one row.
        Parameters:
        array - two-dimensional array of characters
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the array parameter is null or the array is ragged. Any error message is fine.

      • rotateLeftOneColumn

        public static void rotateLeftOneColumn​(char[][] array)
        Rotates the array by shifting columns one position to the left (second column will become the first column, third column will become the second column, etc.). The first column will become the last column. To get the most practice you should not create a new array in order to perform the rotation. No processing takes place if the array only has one column.
        Parameters:
        array - two-dimensional array of characters
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the array parameter is null or the array is ragged. Any error message is fine.

      • appendTopBottom

        public static char[][] appendTopBottom​(char[][] top,
                                       char[][] bottom)
        Returns a new two-dimensional array of characters where elements from the top array appear first, follow by elements from the bottom array. The arrays do not need to have the same number of rows or columns.
        Parameters:
        top - two-dimensional array of characters
        bottom - two-dimensional array of characters
        Returns:
        two-dimensional array of characters

      • appendLeftRight

        public static char[][] appendLeftRight​(char[][] left,
                                       char[][] right)
        Returns a new two-dimensional array of characters where rows with the same index in the left and right arrays have been combined (row from right array appended to corresponding row from left array). The arrays do not need to have the same number of rows or columns.
        Parameters:
        left - two-dimensional array of characters
        right - two-dimensional array of characters
        Returns:
        two-dimensional array of characters
